restore.title: Reset assets database
restore.subtitle: Delete custom assets and reset assets database to its initial state. Caution: This operation might affect other users in the same system using the database for assets.

delete_confirmation.title: Reset assets database
delete_confirmation.message: Do you really want to restore your local assets database? This will keep the assets that you manually added and were not known to rotki before and reset all others to their original state.

hard_restore_message.title: Reset assets database
hard_restore_message.message: Do you really want to reset your local copy of assets? You will lose any custom assets that you may have added manually.

hard_restore_confirmation.title: Dangerous operation
hard_restore_confirmation.message: There are assets that will be deleted and might cause an inconsistent state in this account or other accounts in the system. Confirm this action only if you know what you are doing.

success.description: The asset database has been successfully restored. You will now need to re-login to apply the changes.
success.title: Asset database restore

usage_analytics.title: Usage analytics
usage_analytics.description: rotki is a local application and anonymous usage analytics is the only way for us to have an idea of how many people use our software, where they are from etc. These data are really important to us, are completely anonymous and help us create a better product for you.

cointracking.line_one: Trades/deposits/withdrawals from Cointracking do not include fees.
cointracking.line_two: All trades imported from Cointracking will always be considered as buys due to the way the data are represented.
cointracking.line_three: ETH/BTC Transactions are treated as deposits/withdrawals so they are not imported in rotki. To import ETH transactions simply input your accounts in {0} and they will be imported automatically for you.
cointracking.name: CoinTracking
cointracking.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.
cointracking.preferred: For the above reasons it's preferred to directly connect your exchanges in order to import data from there. If you do not do that a lot of accuracy is lost.

cryptocom.line_one: [Early stage] This import script may miss some transactions types, like withdrawals. Since we can't have an exhaustive list of every type, we develop it using what we know at the time. If you think that import script can be improved and you can help providing more data types, {0}.
cryptocom.line_two: {0} If you want to connect your Crypto.com Exchange account, please wait until we support it and then connect to it as an exchange.
cryptocom.line_two_warning: It only concerns the Crypto.com mobile application.
cryptocom.line_three: Trades/deposits/withdrawals from crypto.com do not include fees details. They are waived at the moment (August 2020) or they are handled in the traded amount.
cryptocom.line_four: Only transactions are imported here (for tax report), if you want the assets be displayed in your rotki balances, you have to add them manually as manual balances: {0}
cryptocom.name: Crypto.com
cryptocom.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.

blockfi.name: BlockFi
blockfi.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
blockfi.line_two: BlockFi lets you export two different files. Trades will be imported from the file that only contains trades.
blockfi.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.

nexo.name: Nexo
nexo.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
nexo.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.

shapeshift.name: ShapeShift
shapeshift.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
shapeshift.line_two: ShapeShift lets you export a trades file. Trades will be imported from the file that only contains trades.
shapeshift.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.

uphold.name: Uphold
uphold.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
uphold.line_two: Uphold lets you export a transactions file. It can be found under activity at the top right of the activity list.
uphold.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.

bisq.name: Bisq
bisq.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
bisq.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.

binance.name: Binance
binance.line_one: Imports: Deposits, Withdrawals, Trades, ETH 2.0 Staking, Small assets exchange BNB, ETH 2.0 Staking Rewards, Launchpool Interest, POS savings interest, POS savings purchase, POS savings redemption.
binance.line_two: Because of binance's csv format there is a chance that not all data will be imported. If this will happen, you will get warning.
binance.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.

import_data.description: You can manually import data from the services below by dragging the file on the respective area or clicking the select button.
import_data.title: Import Data
import_data.notice: {warning} Those platforms could change their format in a backwards incompatible way quite often. As such this import may stop working. If that happens {link} and we will see what we can do.

dashboard_asset_table.no_search_result: Your search for "{search}" yielded no results.

sync_indicator.ignore_errors: Save the balance snapshot ignoring any errors on external APIs. This can cause the snapshot to be incomplete.
sync_indicator.menu_tooltip: View the date of the last balances snapshot | View the date of the last balances snapshot, and the time of the last premium database sync
sync_indicator.snapshot_tooltip: This will force taking a snapshot of all your balances, ignoring any cache. Use this sparingly as it may lead to you being rate-limited.

messages.title: Snapshot import
messages.success_description: Snapshot successfully imported. You will be logged out now.

upload_confirmation.title: Force Push | Force Pull
upload_confirmation.message_upload: By force pushing, any previous synced data residing in the rotki server will be overwritten. There is no way to recover any overwritten data, or revert this action. Please be careful when performing this action as it may cause unintended data loss. By proceeding you acknowledge that you understand the dangers of using this action.
upload_confirmation.message_download: By force pulling, your local database will be replaced with data pulled from the rotki server. There is no way to recover any overwritten data, or revert this action. Please be careful when performing this action as it may cause unintended data loss. By proceeding you acknowledge that you understand the dangers of using this action.
upload_confirmation.message_download_relogin: After performing the pull, a manual re-login will be required.

metamask_import.label: MetaMask
metamask_import.missing: * Importing addresses from MetaMask is disabled. MetaMask could not be detected.

missing_tooltip.title: Here are the common cause:
missing_tooltip.metamask_is_not_installed: This browser doesn't have MetaMask installed. You can download MetaMask {link}.
missing_tooltip.metamask_is_not_enabled: The MetaMask is not enabled yet. You can enable it in menu Extension / Add Ons, depends on your browser.
missing_tooltip.metamask_is_not_supported_by_browser: Make sure you open this page with supported browser listed {link}. If not, please {copy} and open it manually on supported browser.

metamask_import.metamask: * You will be prompted to import your addresses from MetaMask after pressing save.

backend_settings_button.tooltip: Change the backend settings. Changing the settings will restart the rotki backend

premium_reminder.title: Upgrade to Premium
premium_reminder.description: rotki is open source software and needs your support! Please consider upgrading to premium by purchasing a premium subscription. This way you can help us further develop the software and you can also enjoy additional premium-only features.

privacy_notice.title: rotki is a local application that respects your privacy.
privacy_notice.message: rotki accounts are encrypted using your password and saved in your local filesystem.

app.name: rotki
app.moto: the opensource portfolio manager that protects your privacy
